results.title: Music in the woods: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising MUSIC IN THE WOODS, THE ANIMAL GARDEN, WOEFUL AND THE WASPBERRIES, TIDYING TIMOTHY’S BEDROOM and GUMPA SOLVES A JIGSAW PUZZLE. MUSIC IN THE WOODS: Timothy and the special animals spend a day in the woods collecting feathers. As a precaution against any animals getting lost, they take their musical instruments to play if they get lost in the woods. In the woods they meet a new friend, the Parrot, but they soon realise that Little Mut is missing. THE ANIMAL GARDEN: The animals are given their own garden to look after by Timothy. Nothing seems to be growing, until Woeful and Gumpa decide to help things along. WOEFUL AND THE WASPBERRIES: The animals decide to organise a surprise birthday picnic for Timothy and they are all caught up in the preparations, except for Woeful who has forgotten all about Timothy’s birthday. Luckily he has an idea for a present, but it’s an idea that will lead him into all sorts of trouble. TIDYING TIMOTHY’S BEDROOM: When Timothy gets into trouble for having a messy bedroom, the animals decide to surprise him by tidying it themselves. There’s a prize for the first one to finish up, but there are even more surprises in store, especially for Timothy. GUMPA SOLVES A JIGSAW PUZZLE: Timothy and the animals are working on a jigsaw when Timothy is called in for tea. When they resume the puzzle after dinner, they discover a piece missing and the animals must perform a bit of detective work to find the missing piece.

results.title: The Animal shelf
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description: Join the animals on Timothy’s animal shelf- Stripey, Getup, Gumpa, Little Mut and Woeful as they embark on a series of exciting adventures. Based on the books by Ivy Wallace and adapted for television by Julia and Chris Allen. Hottest Day of the Year (310725) Stripey to the Rescue (310728) Music in the Woods (310729) The Mystery of the Pictures (310730) Little Mut Goes Flying (310731)

results.title: The mystery of the pictures: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising THE MYSTERY OF THE PICTURES, TIMOTHY’S GUEST, LITTLE MUT FINDS AN EGG, KINKER’S CAMPING HOLIDAY and TIMOTHY’S HOMEWORK. THE MYSTERY OF THE PICTURES: The animals take some pictures with Timothy’s Polaroid camera and are surprised when dark shapes appear in them. While trying to solve the mystery the animals discover an unexpected visitor living opposite their shelf. TIMOTHY’S GUEST: The animals have a new friend to play with when Timothy offers to look after his cousin’s dog for the weekend. LITTLE MUT FINDS AN EGG: While Timothy is off playing golf the animals search for birds’ nests in Bluebell Wood. Little Mut finds what he is looking for as well as an unexpected visitor. KINKER’S CAMPING HOLIDAY: It seems like Kinker’s holiday is about to turn into one big disaster, but with a little help from the animals and their invention of a home made telephone system, things may turn out alright. TIMOTHY’S HOMEWORK: The animals help Timothy with his homework and do such a good job that Timothy wins a prize.

results.title: Hottest day of the year: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising THE HOTTEST DAY OF THE YEAR, THE WORLD IN THE WOOD, WOEFUL FLIES TO THE MOON, CAPTAIN GUMPA and THE ALARM CLOCK. THE HOTTEST DAY OF THE YEAR: There is a prize to be won for the animals who can come up with the best way of keeping cool on the hottest day of the year. When all their efforts fail, Timothy brings home the winning idea. THE WORLD IN THE WOOD: The animals build themselves houses to protect themselves from wolves after hearing the story of the Three Little Pigs. Woeful has his own plans, plans which backfire when they discover a puppy has escaped from the funfair. WOEFUL FLIES TO THE MOON: The animals become fascinated by the moon and decided they would like to visit it in a space rocket. Woeful claims to have been there and brought back a souvenir- or has he? CAPTAIN GUMPA: Timothy throws a party for Gumpa, the oldest animal on the shelf. Upset at being thought of as an old bear, Gumpa plans to build a boat and sail away. THE ALARM CLOCK: Timothy is given an alarm clock by his mother when he can’t get out of bed in the morning for school. After the alarm keeps going off in the middle of the night the animals hide it, however the clock keeps mysteriously reappearing.

results.title: Little mut goes flying: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising LITTLE MUT GOES FLYING, BABYSITTING FOR MRS MOLE, TIMOTHY’S PET BALLOON, THE TRAIL and THE MODEL MONSTER. LITTLE MUT GOES FLYING: The animals decide to build a see saw- motivated by a trip to the playground. Woeful decides that’s boring and sets off to Bluebell Wood to build a swing. BABYSITTING FOR MRS MOLE: Stripey and Getup babysit the baby moles whilst Mrs Mole is visiting her sick sister. They have their hands full when the babies escape from the summer house. TIMOTHY’S PET BALLOON: The animals start to worry that Timothy doesn’t love them anymore when he tells them that he’s buying a rabbit. An unexpected visitor arrives on the shelf and the animals decide to move into the rabbit hutch. THE TRAIL: The animals become interested in exploration after Timothy reads them a book about explorers. Timothy decides it would be fun if he laid a trail of his own and the animals get a chance to be explorers as they follow the clues Timothy has left them. THE MODEL MONSTER: The animals try their hand at model making after seeing Timothy make a model ship from some old pieces of cardboard and egg boxes.
results.title_for_label: Little mut goes flying: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films

results.title: Stripey to the rescue: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE, GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX, THE TREASURE HUNT, GETUP CRUSOE and KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF. STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE: Timothy’s mother decides that Stripey and Getup are old and dirty and could harm Timothy who is suffering from a cold. She gives them away to a jumble sale but on the way Getup is kidnapped by the circus and meets a mouse called Kinker. GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX: Gumpa decides that he is unwell when he wakes up one morning and his head is turned around the wrong way. His friends, Timothy and Little Mut come out in sympathy. THE TREASURE HUNT: All of the toys are hunting for treasure after Gumpa finds a mysterious plan. Getup and Stripey look in a tunnel, Little Mut is helped by a squirrel and Woeful from Jick the Jackdaw. With everyone on the case, they are sure to find something. GETUP CRUSOE: The animals are listening to Timothy reading ‘Robinson Crusoe’ but the story in interrupted when Timothy has to go to school. After he has left, Stripey has an idea, Getup has an adventure and Little Mut is very brave. KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF: When Stripey and Getup visit Mr Trig’s pet shop with Timothy they find their friend Kinker stuck in a cage. With a little help from Timothy they help him escape and find a new home for him on the animal shelf; Kinker is unhappy however, he wants to go back to his real home.
results.title_for_label: Stripey to the rescue: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films

results.title: The Greatest man in the world
results.creator_credit: Ralph Rosenblum, Ed Lynch and Learning in Focus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
An adaptation of a James Thurber story featuring Brad Davis, Carol Kane and Howard da Silva. The first man to fly solo and non-stop around the world is an illiterate and incorrigible lout. Attempts by newsmen and high government officials to present him as a hero fail dismally. Teleplay by Jeff Wanshel. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph Rosenblum, Ed Lynch and Learning in Focus

results.title: Mark Twain's 'The man that corrupted Hadleyburg'
results.creator_credit: Ralph Rosenblum, Christopher Lucas and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Based on the story of the same title by Mark Twain, about a small town visited by a stranger who concocts a scheme to test the honesty of the town’s leading citizens. Stars Robert Preston, hosted by Henry Fonda.

results.title: The Sky is gray
results.creator_credit: Stan Lathan, Whitney Green and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Based on a short story by Ernest Gaines. Deals with a young black farmboy’s visit to the dentist in a small Louisiana town in the 1940’s. The visit marks the dawning of his social and self-awareness. Commentary by Henry Fonda. Cast: Olivia Cole, James Bond III.
